name: Kylie Robertson
biography:
Kylie Robertson trained as a Scientific Photographer at the Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology(RMIT) then began lecturing at Darwin University's Department of Fine Arts shortly after graduating, where she specialised in new media and photographic studies. In 1998 she returned to Melbourne where she completed her post-graduate degree in Film and Television at the Victorian College of the Arts, specialising in multimedia. During this time Kylie wrote, produced, and directed 'Silent Passages'which received wide acclaim both nationally and internationally, including a spot at MILIA 2000 in Cannes, France.

Kylie's desire to see convergent media come to life on the computer screen has driven her from a self developed interactive film maker, to multiple working roles within the industry and an Australian Film Commission funded interactive drama pilot - Jupiter Green. She has worked as a lecturer, screen designer, interactive content creator, project manager and post-production artist.
